meanings.definition: The practice of granting land to subtenants in exchange for services or rent.
meanings.sent1: Subinfeudations were common in medieval times when lords would give land to peasants for work.
meanings.sent2: The subinfeudations of the estate allowed for a system of land distribution among the villagers.
meanings.sent3: The subinfeudations led to some interesting arrangements where farmers paid rent with crops.
meanings.sent4: In the web of subinfeudations, each piece of land was like a puzzle fitting into the larger picture.
meanings.sent5: The concept of subinfeudations can be compared to a landlord renting out rooms in a big house.

meanings.definition: The act of subdividing a feudal estate into smaller units.
meanings.sent1: The subinfeudations of the estate created smaller parcels of land for different families.
meanings.sent2: Subinfeudations were necessary to manage the vast feudal estates more effectively.
meanings.sent3: The subinfeudations resulted in some comical disputes over property boundaries.
meanings.sent4: The idea of subinfeudations can be seen as breaking down a big problem into smaller, solvable parts.
meanings.sent5: The subinfeudations transformed the large estate into a patchwork of individual holdings.
